translation.en: [father] Let's try to get that in there.
You gonna catch the ball?
-Yeah. -All right.
No, Aiden, I'm not a rookie. I've played football since I was four.
translation.ko: 에이든, 난 초짜가 아니야 난 4살 때부터 미식축구 했어

translation.en: I've played football since I was two or three.
[boy] Say it! One, two, three… easies!
translation.ko: 해 봐! 하나, 둘, 셋, 좋았어!

translation.en: [coach 1] Welcome to football, fellas!
[coach 2] Get over there, man.
[player] Team, down!
[coach 2] You two, come on. Point the other way.
One!
Go!
[coach 3] You know, the Saints…
Let's go, 9U! Let's show how we work!
[coach 3] …it means, "God's people."
Suck it up. This is football. This is what makes you tough.
translation.ko: 받아들이렴, 이게 미식축구고 이렇게 강해지는 거야

translation.en: All right? Come on.
[coach 3] It's all of us.
[man] You run an angle. Angle hook. Go right.
[player] Ready… Go!
[coach 4] A successful program isn't determined
translation.ko: 성공적인 프로그램의 기준이 우승 횟수는 아니에요

translation.en: by how many national championships you have. Yes, that's a good thing,
translation.ko: 성공적인 프로그램의 기준이 우승 횟수는 아니에요 그것도 좋지만

translation.en: but our goal is to make sure that every season, we save a life.
translation.ko: 우리 목표는 매 시즌 한 사람을 살리는 거죠

translation.en: [mother] The Saints have saved my kid.
Because my son did have a lot of self-esteem issues.
And he didn't know what he wanted to do
until he met the Saints.
[coach 3] I'm not even talking about the NFL.
As long as you can get to college and get a free education, I've done my job.
translation.ko: 애들이 대학에 진학하고 무상 교육만 받게 돼도 난 내 일을 한 거죠

translation.en: [coach 1] People hear about Brooklyn, you know, and East New York.
translation.ko: 사람들은 뉴욕 동부 브루클린 얘기를 들으면

translation.en: They think, "Negativity,"
just 'cause the simple fact of the way the news portrays…
You know, 'cause everybody thinks Brooklyn is about the gangs,
translation.ko: 뉴스에서 묘사하는 것들 때문에요 다들 브루클린은 갱 천지고

translation.en: and shooting and killing, the ghetto.
And it's really not like that.
I'm the king of this ship.
[coach 1] If you really look into Brooklyn and into the souls of the people…
-[boy] What's up, Mr. Jimmy? -Hey, boy. What up?
Nothing.
…you'll see another side of Brooklyn.
[man] That's a flower. See? That's the tree.
[coach 1] You'll never hear that across the news.
'Cause that's not the things they look for.
[coach 1] We teach the kids fundamentals of football.
We teach them how to be young men.
Easy. Easy.
[coach 1] We teach the kids to be proud of who you are
translation.ko: 우린 아이들에게 자신과 자신의 뿌리에 자부심을 가지라고 가르쳐요

translation.en: and be proud of where you come from.
translation.ko: 자신과 자신의 뿌리에 자부심을 가지라고 가르쳐요

translation.en: [coach 1] We're not perfect.
It's not easy.
They say it takes a village to raise a child.
translation.ko: 한 아이를 키우려면 한 마을이 필요하다고 해요

translation.en: [coach 1] But the Brooklyn Saints is that village.
This is the Brooklyn people rarely see.
translation.ko: 이건 사람들이 잘 모르는 브루클린의 모습이에요

translation.en: [coach 1] That's the truth.
It's the Brooklyn Saints.
Easy! Let's win this! Good job, Saints!
[coach 1] We are the show.
-Who the show? -[players] We the show!
-Am I my brother's keeper? -[players] You already know!
translation.ko: 내 형제를 지킬 땐? 사력을 다해!

translation.en: -Saints on the field! -[players] You know!
-Where we from? -[players] Brooklyn!
-Where we from? -[players] Brooklyn!
Brooklyn!
[all] We are the Saints! We are the Saints!
What grade you in now?
-Huh? -I said, "What grade you in now?"
-Oh, fifth. -[barber] All right.
-So you graduate this year? -Yeah.
Going back to Florida?
[man] Y'all won the championship last year?
Uh, no, we lost.
[man] What was the score?
Thirty-two-zip.
[man] Zero? Yeah.
[barber] With you on the team and y'all had zero?
-Yeah. -[barber exclaims]
[D-Lo] I have been playing with the Saints for three years so far.
I'm a quarterback.
I love football because since I was young, that was…
translation.ko: 제가 미식축구를 좋아하는 이유는 어릴 때부터

translation.en: That was the only thing I wanted to do when I was young.
I used to come to the football field when I was two or three, with my dad.
translation.ko: 두세 살 때부터 경기장에 오곤 했어요 아빠랑요

translation.en: Try to help out, try to play.
Try to practice with him.
[barber] You know what's-his-name grew up around the corner.
You know who Curtis Samuel is?
He's on the Carolina Panthers now.
Yeah, he grew up around the corner.
I used to cut his hair.
You got to make it to that status.
[D-Lo] I want to play football for the rest of my life
because that's the only thing I want to do.
[woman cheering] Go, D-Lo!
-That's right! Let's go! -[coach 1] Yeah, D-Lo!
-[D-Lo] I'm running it left. -[player] This side? Why?
T and down!
[father] On his right.
Ready?
Go!
[coach 2] That's it!
[coach 3] There it is. That's what I'm talking about.
[coach 1] That's the throw I wanted. All-day D-Lo.
-[coach 2] All-day D-Lo? -[coach 1] One of those rare players.
translation.ko: 만능 딜로네 - 만능 딜로? - 보기 드문 선수예요

translation.en: [coach 2] Right? For real. D-Lo all day.
Huddle. Huddle…
[D-Lo] When people tell me I have the team on my shoulders,
translation.ko: 사람들이 제가 팀을 이끌고 있다고 하면

translation.en: it feels good because, like, I know that I have this.
translation.ko: 기분이 좋아요 전 제가 팀을 W로 이끌 수 있다는 걸 알거든요

translation.en: I can bring them to a "W." I can bring them to a win.
translation.ko: 전 제가 팀을 W로 이끌 수 있다는 걸 알거든요 W는 승리예요

translation.en: Being a Saint, it means to…
be respectful, have fun,
and don't think about the past.
-[boy 1] How much games do we have? -[boy 2] I think… about five or ten.
-Yeah, five or ten. -No, I mean, like, the whole season.
-[Aiden] Five or ten! -[boy] Ten!
So, like, our season, we might go 6-4.
Only if we do good blocking, and…
-Imagine that he jinxes it. -[boy] That's awesome.
-And we go, like, 0-10. -[Mykel] How do you know that?
translation.ko: - 얘가 설레발쳐서... - 그럼 좋지 10번 다 질 거야 그걸 어떻게 알아?

translation.en: Watch, you could jinx it, bro. Watch, you gonna jinx it.
[Mykel] Who'd we play last year for the national championship?
translation.ko: 우리 작년 전국 대회에서 어디랑 붙었지?

translation.en: Did we… Did we play the Ravens--
-Yeah. -…for the national championship?
And then we lost.
[Mykel] When we make it to Florida, I want revenge.
If we do blocking and good running and--
translation.ko: 우리가 블로킹 제대로 하고 잘 뛰면...

translation.en: [Aiden] And get better passing and better snaps,
yes… we… could!
Want this one? This is light.
No.
[coach] Remember, grab the bag, all right?
Don't push it. Wrap it. -Okay. -All right?
-[groans] -There we go.
[boy] To be a Saint, you have to love everybody.
translation.ko: 세인츠 팀원이 되려면 모두를 사랑해야 해요

translation.en: If somebody's down, you've got to pick them up. On all courses.
translation.ko: 누가 쓰러지면 일으켜 줘야 하죠 항상요

translation.en: It's all love in the Brooklyn Saints.
Like, when we on the field, we're connected.
Instead of just being a sport, it's like a family.
You can just come together and just talk.
We always go to each other's birthday parties,
translation.ko: 우린 늘 서로의 생일 파티에 가고

translation.en: and we also go to their house.
Like, um, we even go if it's in Long Island.
Everybody on this team is my family.
9U, say, "Welcome, Man Man, to the Brooklyn Saints family."
translation.ko: 이렇게 말하는 거야 '맨맨, 브루클린 세인츠 가족이 된 걸 환영해'

translation.en: [all] Welcome, Man Man, to the Brooklyn Saints family.
translation.ko: 맨맨, 브루클린 세인츠 가족이 된 걸 환영해

translation.en: Everybody give him a quick "Easy" before we start practice.
[all] Easy!
-Y'all ready to work today? -Yes, coach.
All right, let me tighten you up so we can get working, get ready.
translation.ko: 좋아, 장비 조여 줄게 경기 시작할 수 있게

translation.en: [player] Dang, you got big muscles.
But, got a small head.
9U, if you got a mouthpiece, put it in your mouth so you're not talking.
translation.ko: 다들 마우스피스 입에 넣어 그래야 안 떠들지

translation.en: [all] Yes, coach. Yes, coach.
Let's get him! Let's get him! He ain't going nowhere. Let's get him!
translation.ko: 잡아! 놓치지 말고 잡아! 좋았어! 올해는 이렇게 뛰는 거야

translation.en: Easy! We want all that smoke this year. Let's get him!
translation.ko: 놓치지 말고 잡아! 좋았어! 올해는 이렇게 뛰는 거야 잡아!

translation.en: The Saints organization started over ten years ago.
translation.ko: 세인츠 팀이 시작된 건 10년도 더 됐죠

translation.en: I believe in mid-2009.
My staff consists of my vice president, Dave,
our founder, Puma, and Shon.
Nice!
And my wife, Khadeja, which is pretty much our administration.
translation.ko: 그리고 내 아내 카디자로 구성돼 있어요

translation.en: -[groans] -[Shon] Get up, get up, get up!
We used to have what they call, "PAL." "Police Athletic Leagues."
translation.ko: 예전엔 'PAL'이란 게 있었어요 경찰 체육 리그요

translation.en: No more.
They used to leave the schools open for activities.
translation.ko: 거기서 체육 활동을 위해 학교 공간을 빌려줬었는데

translation.en: All of those programs are cut.
This is where we step in.
[Puma] We just try to put you in position where you can better yourself in life.
translation.ko: 우린 누군가가 더 나은 삶을 살 수 있도록 도와주죠

translation.en: It don't have to be with sports.
Doctor, a lawyer, it could be any one of those things.
As long as we get you a free education,
we did our job.
Let's get three. Easy. Easy.
[Dave] With our program, it all starts with Coach Gawuala.
translation.ko: 우리 프로그램은 가왈라 코치와 함께 시작됐어요

translation.en: -What's up, young man? How you feeling? -Good.
Welcome to the Saints. Thanks for coming out.
translation.ko: - 좋아요 - 세인츠에 잘 왔다 와 줘서 고마워

translation.en: -Saints, how y'all feel? -[all] You know!
That is the heart and soul of our organization.
Everybody, show some love.
It's the Brooklyn way.
Easy. Let's get it.
Happy feet.
-[man] What's going on, bro? -Let's go, boy. I'm here.
[Gawuala] I started that back in 2009 when we started the organization.
I felt like I had to salute each kid that came out
to participate into playing football.
'Cause it's not easy and it's a lot. It's a lot to go through,
translation.ko: 쉬운 일이 아니거든요 힘든 일이 많기 때문에 전 모든 아이에게 경례해요

translation.en: so that's just me saluting the kids for coming out. I salute them.
translation.ko: 힘든 일이 많기 때문에 전 모든 아이에게 경례해요

translation.en: Three claps and a salute.
Salute you, salute the Saints, salute your parents.
Just salute to the people that make it happen.
D-Lo, it's your year this year, baby boy. You already know.
translation.ko: 딜로, 올해는 너의 해야 너도 알지?

translation.en: [Demel] He brings out the eagerness and the drive
and determination in them kids.
He makes them believe that they can do anything,
translation.ko: 뭐든 할 수 있다고 믿게 만들어요

translation.en: they can be anybody at any given time.
If Gawuala told some kids that they could fly,
translation.ko: 가왈라가 애들한테 날 수 있다고 말하면

translation.en: they'd go home and say, "Mommy, Daddy, I can fly
translation.ko: 애들은 이러겠죠 '엄마, 아빠, 저 날 수 있어요'

translation.en: because Gawuala said I could fly."
When I say "three," you give me an "Ooh, ooh, ooh, ooh!"
translation.ko: 내가 '셋' 하면 '오, 오, 오, 오' 하는 거야

translation.en: One! Two! Three! [all] Ooh, ooh, ooh, ooh!
translation.ko: 하나, 둘, 셋! 오, 오, 오, 오!

translation.en: If Coach Gawuala can do it, you can do it. Call it.
translation.ko: 가왈라 코치가 하면 너희도 할 수 있어, 시작해

translation.en: Go! Ready… go!
[coach] I mean, everybody need to do good in school, always.
School is first. Responsibility at home.
translation.ko: 학교가 먼저고 집에서 할 일이 두 번째고

translation.en: And then football.
You understand me?
[all] Yes, coach.
[Demel] So, we have three levels.
We have the 9U, which is seven to the age of nine.
We have an 11U, which has kids from ten to 11-year-olds.
And we have a 13U, which has kids from 12 to 13.
Set…
[coach] Watch him.
Go!
[coach] Do the turn. Uh-huh, good.
That's where it's supposed to be. Do it again!
translation.ko: 저 위치에 있었어야 해, 다시 해

translation.en: Set… go!
[Dave] 13U? Boy, oh, boy.
No experience whatsoever.
I would say three kids, probably, had played football ever.
translation.ko: 미식축구를 해 본 애가 3명 정도였을 거예요

translation.en: And, because of that, Kenan became a leader.
Down! Set… go!
[Kenan] I been playing football for almost like a decade now.
Since I was four years old.
My brothers, they used to play football.
So, actually, I caught love with it while watching them playing football.
[Gawuala] We got a couple of new guys over here, so…
[Kenan] We didn't have a quarterback, so I decided to step up and take that role
translation.ko: 우린 쿼터백이 없었어요 그래서 제가 나서서 그 역할을 맡고

translation.en: and be the leader.
Squeeze the ball tight, over…
translation.ko: 공을 꽉 잡은 다음에 오버핸드로 던지는 거야

translation.en: Dart it. All right?
[Kenan] This is my last youth season.
translation.ko: 이번이 유소년 팀에 있는 마지막 시즌인데

translation.en: I just want to bring it out with a good year.
Set… go!
[coach in distance] Caught the ball, right? Good!
[Demel] Having my son play on the team, of course, you'll look at it
translation.ko: 아들이 팀에 있다 보니 사람들은 이렇게 볼 거예요

translation.en: like, "Okay, that's his father, he's gonna get special treatment."
translation.ko: 사람들은 이렇게 볼 거예요 '아버지 덕에 쟨 특별 대우를 받겠네'

translation.en: But, on the flip side, we're really, really hard on him.
translation.ko: 하지만 우린 오히려 애를 엄격하게 대해요

translation.en: We expect more from him than we expect from anyone else.
translation.ko: 다른 애들한테보다 더 많은 걸 바라죠

translation.en: We got to keep you working out.
This is gonna be a big year for you this year, so we've got to have you ready.
translation.ko: 너한테 중요한 해가 될 테니 준비돼 있어야 해

translation.en: [Demel] Stop going away from it. Stop fading away. Go into the ball.
Better.
Look how far your brother's knee is bent.
Get it bent, then you put this foot back to where it's comfortable.
translation.ko: 구부리고, 발을 뒤로 빼 편안한 위치로

translation.en: [Demel] Set… go!
-Watch your hands right here. Go ahead. -[coach] Put your hands up.
translation.ko: 여기서 손을 잘 봐, 시작해 손을 올려야지

translation.en: Your hands up, up, up! Like you ready to fight.
Like you ready to fight. This is a fight.
translation.ko: 싸울 준비가 된 것처럼 이건 싸움이야 서로 이렇게 가까워지면

translation.en: When we this close to each other, we fighting.
translation.ko: 이건 싸움이야 서로 이렇게 가까워지면 싸우는 거지

translation.en: -You got it? -[Kenan] Uh-huh.
Look, you got all your brothers here. You see how much knowledge you getting?
translation.ko: 여기 네 형제들이 다 있잖아 얼마나 많은 걸 배우겠어

translation.en: All right, you're the last of our legacy. You know we all got you.
translation.ko: 넌 우리의 마지막 유산이야 모두 널 돕고 있어

translation.en: Everybody putting everything that we… All our knowledge,
translation.ko: 우리의 모든 지식과 속도, 파워, 에너지를

translation.en: all our speed, power, energy, into you.
translation.ko: 우리의 모든 지식과 속도, 파워, 에너지를 너에게 쏟고 있는 거야

translation.en: So just take it all in and perform.
-You got it? -Uh-huh.
All right?
[coach] Even if he is here, boom. Might get somebody, too close.
translation.ko: 여기 있어도 부딪혀 너무 가까워질 수도 있어

translation.en: [Kenan] Football is like…
I wanna take that as far as I could.
If I can't go to the pros, I'll use it to my ability to go to college,
translation.ko: 프로 팀에 못 들어가면 미식축구로 대학에 가서

translation.en: get a good education, learn something.
translation.ko: 좋은 교육을 받고 뭔가를 배울 거예요

translation.en: [teacher 1] I said get your robots, get your laptops,
let's bring our programs up and let's get to it.
[teacher 1] Where we at, Kenan?
That's so odd.
[teacher 1] I mean, I am leaning on the table. Try it again.
translation.ko: 난 테이블에 기대 있을 테니 다시 해봐

translation.en: As young, he would piece puzzles together. And not like regular, uh…
translation.ko: 어릴 때 키넌은 퍼즐을 맞추곤 했어요 평범한 거 말고...

translation.en: Big puzzles. Like 100-piece puzzles, he's like four or five years old.
He didn't even look at the picture. He'd just take the shapes
and, because of the way the shapes are,
he knew which puzzle piece lined up. He wouldn't even look at the box.
translation.ko: 어느 조각이 맞는지 알았던 거예요 상자는 쳐다보지도 않았죠

translation.en: I knew from then that this kid is something different.
translation.ko: 그때부터 이 아이가 남다르다는 걸 알았어요

translation.en: [teacher 1] It's stopping there every time. Why is it doing this?
translation.ko: 매번 여기서 멈추는데 왜 그런 거지? 1.4로 맞췄어요

translation.en: [Kenan] I put it to 1.4.
[teacher 1] One-point-four? Well, then, keep adding.
It feel like it's first-and-ten and we on a goal line
translation.ko: 애가 경기하는 걸 보면 퍼스트 다운을 하고

translation.en: when you watching him compete.
[teacher 2] Ah! Run again.
[Demel] So, when I see him really execute something,
it's like, "Wow."
It's almost the same feeling he has when he scores a touchdown.
translation.ko: 애가 터치다운 했을 때 기분을 나도 그대로 느껴요

translation.en: [Kenan] That one worked out.
-[laughs] -[teacher 2] That works.
You all right? What's next?
[Kenan] When I started robotics, I seen this whole new world open up.
translation.ko: 로봇 공학을 시작했을 때 완전히 새로운 세계가 열린 것 같았어요

translation.en: And it was just, like, "I wanna do this when I get older."
translation.ko: 이걸 하고 싶단 생각이 들었죠 나이가 들면요

translation.en: [man 1] Gawuala, Gawuala!
What's good, Bubba? How you doing, good?
Everything cool?
Yeah, yeah..
-[man 2] What's up, brother? -You got kids? How old?
Nine and 14.
-Yeah, that's perfect. -He'll like it.
Give me a pen. I'll give you my number.
translation.ko: 펜 줘 봐요, 내 번호 줄게요

translation.en: He's gonna love it.
-American football, not soccer. -[man] Yeah.
"Coach Eddie," all right? I'll bring you some information.
translation.ko: 코치 에디예요 몇 가지 더 알려드릴게요

translation.en: -Thank you. I appreciate it. -A flyer and some information.
-Thank you. I appreciate you. -No problem.
All this… All this is my stomping grounds.
My mother was raising six kids in a two-bedroom apartment.
translation.ko: 우리 어머니는 투룸 아파트에서 자식 6명을 키우셨죠

translation.en: Uh, she did wonderful work, what she did with us.
Never been to college. I don't know what college is.
translation.ko: 난 대학에 안 갔고 대학이 뭔지도 몰라요

translation.en: I never graduated high school.
I never got a chance to walk across the stage and pick up a diploma.
translation.ko: 그런 단상에 올라 졸업장을 받을 기회가 없었죠

translation.en: None of that. I wasn't into that.
I was, um… young and lost in life. I was reckless.
translation.ko: 난 어렸고 인생에서 길을 잃었었죠 무모했어요

translation.en: Um, I didn't think of graduating school and all, getting a GED, or none of that.
translation.ko: 학교를 졸업하거나 검정고시를 딸 생각은 없었죠

translation.en: We can't stay in the past. We got to learn from our mistakes
translation.ko: 과거에 머물 순 없어요 실수를 통해 배워야 하죠 실수를 통해 배우지 않으면

translation.en: 'cause if you don't learn from your mistakes,
translation.ko: 실수를 통해 배워야 하죠 실수를 통해 배우지 않으면

translation.en: you're just gonna be lost in the system and that's what the system wants.
translation.ko: 사회 제도 안에서 길을 잃을 거예요 그게 제도가 원하는 거죠

translation.en: The system wants us to be lost and…
So they can continue to conquer and keep us divided, and…
translation.ko: 그래야 계속 우리를 지배하고 우리를 갈라놓을 수 있죠

translation.en: We greater than that.
[Gawuala] To be a coach is a lot.
'Cause when you a coach, the world puts you on a pedestal that…
They look at you as a perfection person.
And I'm far from…
I'm far from perfect. I'm far from a role model.
I'm a human being. I make mistakes. I have mistakes. I do get stressed.
translation.ko: 난 사람이고 실수를 하죠 스트레스도 받고

translation.en: I have my own problems that I deal with in life and, um,
translation.ko: 살면서 감당해야 하는 개인적인 문제도 있어요

translation.en: I try to keep it separate, but once in a while, it catches up to me.
translation.ko: 공과 사를 구별하려 하지만 가끔은 그게 안 되죠

translation.en: Especially, you start as the young age group like I do,
translation.ko: 특히 어린아이들과 만나는 일을 하게 되면

translation.en: you basically raise a lot of these kids,
translation.ko: 특히 어린아이들과 만나는 일을 하게 되면 그 애들을 키우는 거나 같아요

translation.en: so they definitely become yours, and a piece of your heart.
translation.ko: 그 애들을 키우는 거나 같아요 내 자식이자 심장의 일부가 되는 거라

translation.en: So when they hurt, you hurt.
Believe, when you down, they see it and they know.
So I just feed off the energy they give me and try to make a positive out of it.
translation.ko: 난 애들이 주는 에너지를 긍정적인 기운으로 바꾸려고 해요

translation.en: 9U, if you ready to put work in today, give me a, "Haa!"
Yeah, we about to work today. That's what I like to hear.
[Aiden] Coach Puma? Are you happy for hell week?
-[Puma] Are you happy? -Yes, actually.
[coach 1] Hell week. We practice every day.
…time to get serious, now.
Almost game time.
Two weeks, let's go!
Welcome to your worst nightmare.
[coach 1] Game faces on, let's go!
Go! Go, RJ! Push him, RJ! Let's go!
translation.ko: 시작! 밀어붙여, RJ! 밀어, RJ! 힘껏!

translation.en: -[coach] Go! -[Demel] Good job.
-[coach] Go! -[Demel] Stay there.
Go!
Go!
[blows whistle] Nice!

Clap it up for y'all selves, man. Good work, man. Aight?
If we play well this season,
we get a chance to go to Florida and play for the national championship.

translation.en: -Who wants to go to Florida? -[players] Me!

translation.ko: 그러려면 먼저 롱아일랜드 연습 경기에서 잘해야 해

translation.en: in Long Island. Who's ready?
translation.ko: 그러려면 먼저 롱아일랜드 연습 경기에서 잘해야 해 - 준비된 사람? - 준비됐어요!

translation.en: -[all] We ready! -[Puma] That's right.
Time to get ready, understand?
-Yes, coach! -All right!
[coach] For a week, we will be working. For a week, we will be working.
-[Vick] Down, up! -[players] Two! Three!
-[Demel] There it is. -Shake it off!
Go ahead, bro. Use them legs. Run! You fast!
translation.ko: 계속 가, 다리를 써야지! 뛰어, 빠르잖아!

translation.en: Let's go.
[Vick] Come in front, D-Lo.
Say, "I don't accept punishment, I give it."
translation.ko: 따라 해, '벌은 받는 게 아니라 내가 주는 거다'

translation.en: [players] I don't accept punishment, I give it.
translation.ko: 벌은 받는 게 아니라 내가 주는 거다

translation.en: -[boy] Ready? Let's go. -[Vick] D-Lo, be a leader.
[Vick] It's time to work harder. Any day! Any day, now.
translation.ko: 더 열심히 해야 해 이제 얼마 안 남았어!

translation.en: You guys got to get in better shape.
Encourage each other.
Hello? Hello?

-Break down! -[players yell]
[coach] Hustle. Let's go!
[Shon] Go.
It is his responsibility to get you the ball.

[Aiden] I was raised for hell week, bro.
I was going through hell since I was three.
[Gawuala] Come Saturday next week, we going to war.
translation.ko: 다음 주 토요일에는 전쟁에 나설 거다

translation.en: -Do you understand me? -[players] Yes, coach.
[Gawuala] We have a game to play, so we have to make a statement now.
translation.ko: 경기를 앞뒀으니까 이제 투지를 보여줘야 해

translation.en: -[player yells] -[Demel] Oh, goodness. Fumble, fumble!
-[player] Fumble! Oh! -[Gawuala] Come here!
Get this out. Get a minute. Right now, take a minute.

[Gawuala] It's evenly matched. Tell your brother, "Sorry."
Get him some water.
-You all right? -Nah, I'm good.
[Gawuala] Give him three. Let's go. It's all right, Aiden.

translation.en: It's football, this happens. You all right.
translation.ko: 괜찮아, 에이든 미식축구에선 이런 일도 있고

translation.en: He ain't mean to hurt you. Believe me, he didn't.
translation.ko: 널 해치려던 게 아니었어 내 말 믿으렴

translation.en: [Aiden] He did it on accident.
I'm telling y'all the truth. I was afraid to get back in.
But I've played with them for six years.
translation.ko: 하지만 전 걔네랑 6년 동안 미식축구를 했고

translation.en: If I don't trust them,
why am I here and what I'm doing here for?
Shake it off. It's all right. It happens, all right?
-It's my breathing… [whines] -All right. Just relax. Take this off.
Relax, relax. You excited right now. Just relax, let him breathe.
-[Dave] Drop your shoulder. -Come on.
Look. Put your hands up. Let's go through our nose…
translation.ko: 손 위로 들고 코로 숨 들이마셔

translation.en: [breathes deeply] Out through our mouth. In through our nose.
Get your breathing together. It's a learning lesson.
Next time, drop your shoulder first. Lowest man wins the battle.
translation.ko: 다음엔 어깨부터 내려 가장 낮은 자가 전투에서 이기지

translation.en: You know that. You've been with me for four years.
I love you, baby boy!
[Aiden] I know I could do better, but I don't find it yet in me.
translation.ko: 더 잘할 수 있단 걸 알지만 아직 잠재력을 꺼내지 못했어요

translation.en: Coach Gawuala, he took me under his wing
and now I'm just playing football for a living.
That's what I'm trying to do.
-[Dave] Quick question. You making dinner? -[woman on phone] Yes.
[Dave] All right. We'll be here in about… It says 52 minutes.
[woman] All right.
[Dave] We only sleep upstate.
We still live in Brooklyn.
[Aiden] Some days, we just take showers and go to sleep.
Yup. And then wake up right the next morning.
translation.ko: 맞아요, 그러고 다음 날 아침 일찍 일어나죠

translation.en: [Aiden] Yup. Not even the morning, in the night.
Oh, it's the morning, bro.
-[Aiden] 4:30 is the morning? -Yes.
On a practice day, practice is over at 8:00.
Driving everybody home,
and peoples who don't have rides that we have to give them rides,
I figure we leave Brooklyn at 9:00, get there about 10:30, 11:00-ish.
translation.ko: 그럼 우린 9시에 브루클린에서 출발해 10시 반, 11시쯤 도착하죠

translation.en: And then we're up every morning at 4:30.
-[Aiden] Yeah. -Rolled-eyes emoji.
[Dave] It's a lot slower once you get up there and a lot peaceful.
translation.ko: 집에 도착하면 마음이 훨씬 느긋하고 편안해져요

translation.en: [Aiden] Upstate is like my vacation.
And Brooklyn is just all business, about football and school.
[Dave] Hey, lady.
So, let me ask you a question. How everybody gets a "hi"
when they walk in,
but you don't say nothing to me?
[son] Hey, sir.
-It's me for TV. -All right, stop.
[Dave] Is this what you been doing all day?
Yeah… well, not all day.
Grandma was on in the morning like always.
-You blaming Grandma? -I'm not--
translation.ko: 할머니 탓하는 거야? - 그런 거 아니에요 - 할머니도 내팽개치진 마라

translation.en: -Don't throw Grandma under that bus. -All right.
translation.ko: - 그런 거 아니에요 - 할머니도 내팽개치진 마라 알겠어요

translation.en: -[Grandma] You good? -Yeah.
Okay.
[Dave] They love it up here.
And they don't mind me driving.
translation.ko: 내가 운전하는 건 신경도 안 쓰죠

translation.en: Grandma…
that's my rock.
She helps out a lot.
I grew up without a father.
So…
you kind of wing it as you go.
translation.ko: 그냥 되는 대로 아빠 역할을 하죠

translation.en: And what mistakes I've made with the oldest,
I fixed with the youngest.
Brooklyn Saints is a second job.
A non-paying, volunteer, non-profit second job.
I've got 61 boys that I got to take care of.
Plus, coaches and staff.
You know, these boys deserve the best.
So…
Men do wonderful things when they put their heart first.
translation.ko: 열성을 다하면 사람은 놀라운 일을 해내죠

translation.en: -It's time to get up. -[Aiden sighs]
-Here, bud. -See you later, sir.
-[Aiden] Why you always do that, Dad? -Do what?
translation.ko: - 왜 항상 그러세요, 아빠? - 내가 뭘?

translation.en: Put your hands on your face.
So I get 13 seconds of sleep.
[Dave] There's a lot of opportunities for my boys down here
translation.ko: 아이들한텐 북부보다 이쪽에 기회가 더 많아요

translation.en: than it is up there, as far as football.
translation.ko: 아이들한텐 북부보다 이쪽에 기회가 더 많아요 미식축구에 있어서요

translation.en: So…
it's my routine every day.
♪ Don't need to worry about it ♪

[coach] Good morning. How are you?
-[boy 1] This is very-- -[boy 2] No, that was it. That was it.

You with me yet? Get up on y'all feet!
Let's rock with Gawuala. Rock with Gawuala, yeah!
Let's get it. Rock with Gawuala, Saints. Rock with Gawuala!
-We're gonna have fun. Is that understood? -Yes, coach!
translation.ko: - 우린 신나게 뛸 거야, 알겠어? - 네, 코치님!

translation.en: One option on today's menu is to have fun.
Forget about the mistakes. I don't care about that.
translation.ko: 실수는 잊어라 난 그런 건 관심 없어

translation.en: All I care about is you guys having fun today.
translation.ko: 나한테 중요한 건 오늘 너희가 즐기는 거야

translation.en: -Is that understood? -Yes, coach!
-Break down! -[all yell] -Break down! -[all yell]
Let's get it, fellas.
[man] Quiet down. Quiet down. Quiet down.
This ain't fair.
I'm keeping getting rained on.
[boy] Yo! It's dripping!
[Aiden] It's falling in my eyes.
See? I keep my babies dry.
Puerto Ricans is nice with tape. We can fix anything with tape.

translation.en: -[boy] I'm Puerto Rican! -I know. You'll fix a car with tape.

translation.en: Watch when you get older.
-Understand the mathematics now. Hey? -[laughing]
-[D-Lo] Get outta here. -Huh, D-Lo?
We make dirt bikes out of tape, baby. Easy.
[boy] I used to live in Pennsylvania,
so I saw houses like these, but not a lot of them.
translation.ko: 그래서 이런 집들을 봤었죠 많이는 아니고요

translation.en: [coach] We six minutes away. Let's get ready.

translation.en: Their football programs are sponsored by their communities,
by the Nassau Police Department, by some police department.
Our growth comes from our parents,
to where it's harder for us to get funding in inner-city stuff for our kids
translation.ko: 빈민 지역 지원금을 받기가 더 어려워서죠

translation.en: because where we are coming from, in Brooklyn.
We actually had a team forfeit
because they didn't want to come to Brooklyn.
So, that's the demographic.
It's hard to get teams to come to Brooklyn to play. It's very hard.
translation.ko: 다른 지역 팀을 브루클린으로 부르기가 어렵죠 정말 어려워요, 위치가...

There they go.
[coach] There they go.
[man 2] Let's go, let's go, let's go!

They feel like they're out of the state somewhere,

Know what I'm saying? Let's smack on them, y'all.
No Saint put your head down if you make a mistake.

If you stand inside and shoot that gap as soon as the ball is hiked,

Ready… go!

[Gawuala] Keep going, keep going!

I told you one-on-one to give 'em that game.

[coach] Get on the ball!
Watch the cook up, baby! Watch the cook up. Hey, D-Lo!

-[coach 1] Go, go, go! -[coach 2] Y'all there!

Saints on Gawuala!

-[Gawuala] Let's go! Good work! -[coach] Let's go.
Now, y'all doing very good out here.
-I'm very impressed by what I'm seeing. -[coach] Good job!
I've got seven-year-olds stepping up. Eight-year-olds stepping up.
My vets, y'all stepping up so big, it's incredible.

and as a team and as a family is learn from each other.

King.

translation.ko: 9U, 집중해서 봐 형들이 경기를 뛸 거야

translation.en: [boy 1] We can learn from them.
-[boy 2] I cannot see, Coach Isaiah. -[whistle blows]
Get your split. All you need to do is snap him the ball, bro.
translation.ko: 간격 잡아! 쟤들은 공을 내던지기만 한다고!

translation.en: -Who is not blocking? -You gotta go forward, Tyrel.
You gotta hold your man!
You're not blocking, play shotgun.
translation.ko: 네가 한 건 블로킹이 아니라 샷건 플레이야

translation.en: [coach] Go, Kenan, go! Go, Kenan.
[coach] Let's go, Kenan! Let's go, Kenan!
[9U players] Let's go, Kenan! Let's go, Kenan!
Yo, Trey!
[coach] Stop this crying. What did I told you about that anger?
You don't let them tears fall. You inflict that pain on somebody else.
translation.ko: 눈물 흘리면 안 돼 그 고통을 상대에게 주란 말이야

translation.en: Where is the testosterone in the house? Why does everybody cry?
translation.ko: 테스토스테론은 어디 있지? 왜 다들 우는 거야?

translation.en: Everybody cries.
[Gawuala] It's 2019.
What? [Gawuala] It's 2019.
Oh, my God. Oh!
[Gawuala] They sensitive.
I need a Tylenol or a Motrin or something.
[Kenan] Huddle! Laser.
If we get a touchdown on the play, we won the game.
-[coach] Let's go! -[Kenan] Go!
Let's go, let's go!
Let's go!
Rack it up! Yes, yes!
-[coach] That's how you play the best… -[Dede] Six, zip!
-That's right! -[woman] We got this!
We do'ed it! Oh!
[coach] Keep your head up, young man. Y'all balled out.
translation.ko: 고개 들어 너희 모두 잘했어 고개 들어, 잘했어

translation.en: Keep your head up, fellas. Way to ball! Keep y'all heads up. Way to ball!
translation.ko: 너희 모두 잘했어 고개 들어, 잘했어

translation.en: I got something to say.
We got two weeks of practice before our next game.
-I need everybody at practice. -Yes, sir.
-All right? -[all] Yes, captain.
I don't care if y'all come late. I need you at practice, all right?
-[all] Yes, captain. -All right?
-All right, bring it in. One, two, three! -[all] Hard work!
translation.ko: 자, 손 모으자 - 하나, 둘, 셋! - 파이팅!

translation.en: [Gawuala] …energy for game time. B-Rock, I'll see you later.
translation.ko: 에너지를 아껴 둬야지 B록, 나중에 보자고

translation.en: [boy 1] Look, another balloon! It's going to China?
[boy 2] Yes, the balloon's going to China.
translation.ko: 응, 저 풍선은 중국에 갈 거야

translation.en: If you knew how to catch better, it would've been two-nothing.
-[Dave] We're going to the Poconos. -[boy] To the Poconos?
translation.ko: 우린 포코노스에 갈 거야 - 포코노스요? - 포코노스 알지?

translation.en: -That's the Poconos, isn't it? -[boy] We're going to PA, right?
[Dave] It's the Poconos, right?
[Dave] Coach Moe and Coach Gawuala does a lot for their kids. Not just football.
translation.ko: 모 코치님과 가왈라 코치님은 아이들을 위해 많은 일을 해요 미식축구 외에도요

translation.en: -Y'all ready to have some fun up there? -[boy 1] Yes.
Coach Gawuala, is the place actually haunted?
translation.ko: 네, 가왈라 코치님 거기 유령 나오는 데죠?

translation.en: I don't know. We gonna figure it out tonight.
[Dave] Coming from the city,
and only seeing bricks and pavement, and…
You know, it takes a lot to sleep outside in the wild,
when this is where you come from.
[Gawuala] Now, hold it right there.
It's gonna stand right now, Miguel. Trust this, watch this.
translation.ko: 이제 세워질 거야, 미겔 잘 봐

translation.en: Hold that, A.
-As a matter of fact, hold this. -I can hold it now.
Right there.
-[Gawuala] Okay, see what I just did? -Uh-huh.
-[boy] Hey, yo, Coach. -Yes, sir?
The ridges isn't connected to one of them.
translation.ko: 폴이 어딘가 연결이 안 된 것 같아요

translation.en: [Gawuala] Give me one second.
[Vick] D-Lo. -What? -Put it through the hole, man.
-Two, three, four, five, six. -Three, four, five, six.
[Vick] You wanna eat? Grab a rock. Help him carry that rock.
translation.ko: 밥 먹으려면 바위 가져와 옮기는 거 도와줘

translation.en: Okay…
[boy 1] Coach Gawuala…
Do you know the WiFi password?
[Gawuala] There's no such thing as WiFi in the woods.
-[boy 1] Oh! -[Gawuala] You are out of the city.
You are living the "wilderless" life.
There's no cable, no WiFi, no internet,
no Facebook, no Snapchat, no nothing.
You know how you communicate?
-[boy 2] He got YouTube. -See how we're talking?
translation.ko: - 얘 유튜브 있어요 - 우리가 대화하는 거

translation.en: -That's called communication. -I know.
That's how you communicate amongst your brothers.
-What if we're separated? -Listen. Shh! This is why we're camping.
translation.ko: - 서로 떨어져 있으면요? - 잘 들어 이게 우리가 캠핑하는 이유야

translation.en: So we can get a bond and we can be brothers.
-We can communicate better. -[boy 3] Is there any water?
translation.ko: - 소통을 더 잘할 수 있지 - 물 있어요?

translation.en: So when it comes game time… Give me a second.
Comes game time, and coach relays a message to Miguel
translation.ko: 경기 날에는 코치가 미겔한테 메시지를 전달하고

translation.en: and Miguel relays it to the rest of the team,
our "communication" is up to par and we know what we got to do,
translation.ko: 서로 소통이 잘 돼야 협력이 잘 돼 한 팀으로서, 이해했어?

translation.en: -as one team. Is that understood? -[all] Yes, coach.
translation.ko: 협력이 잘 돼 한 팀으로서, 이해했어? 네, 코치님

translation.en: -[Aiden] How many packs you had? -[boy] What?
-How many packs of chips you had? -Two.
Two? We're only supposed to get one.
Oh, yeah. Yeah, I only had one.
-[Kodak] Give me my phone back. -[boy] Oh, good. It's that one again.
translation.ko: 내 휴대폰 내놔 오, 또 그거네

translation.en: [Gawuala] Kodak!
I do not care what's the circumstance.
You do not touch nobody's child out here.
-Do you got me? -Yes.
You wanna put your hands on somebody,
you go pick up a brick and throw it at a tree.
I wasn't gonna touch him.
It's just that he took my phone and I was trying to get it back.
translation.ko: 걔가 제 휴대폰을 가져가서 다시 뺏으려던 거였어요

translation.en: Okay, come to Coach Gawuala. Let Coach Gawuala deal with it. Got it?
translation.ko: 알겠다, 다음부턴 날 찾아와 내가 해결해 주마 알겠지?

translation.en: Anything you need, if you feel opposite, you feel like you gotta scream,
translation.ko: 필요한 게 있거나 반발심이 생기거나 소리 지르고 싶으면

translation.en: you come to Coach Gawuala first.
If we have to scream together, we'll do it together,
translation.ko: 같이 소리 질러야 하면 같이 할 거야

translation.en: -is that understood? -Yes, coach.
Give me my three.
Easy. I love you.
Go help your brothers out.
-[boy] Thank you. -[coach] Okay.
[Gawuala] How many guys is having fun? Raise your hand.
We brought you guys camping
for the simple fact y'all played a wonderful game.
Y'all starting to understand football. Y'all starting to have fun in football.
translation.ko: 미식축구가 뭔지 미식축구의 즐거움이 뭔지 이해하기 시작했지

translation.en: So we decided to bring you guys camping to enjoy the time out here.
translation.ko: 그래서 너희랑 캠핑을 오기로 한 거야 자연에서 너희와 함께 시간을 보내려고

translation.en: How many guys heard cop cars driving past just now?
translation.ko: 지금 경찰차 지나가는 소리 들은 사람?

translation.en: You heard a cop car drove past here?
-[boy 1] Mm-mmm. -[boy 2] No.
-[Aiden] Did you say a cop car? -That's the difference.
How many guys seen police drive past here or heard an ambulance drive through here?
translation.ko: 여기서 경찰차 보거나 앰뷸런스 소리 들은 사람?

translation.en: Nobody, right? This is why we do this.
translation.ko: 아무도 없지? 이게 캠핑을 하는 이유야

translation.en: So we can take you out of your everyday environment.
translation.ko: 너희를 일상적인 환경에서 벗어나게 하는 거

translation.en: How many of you guys feel free right now? Raise your hand.
translation.ko: 지금 자유롭다고 느끼는 사람? 손들어 봐

translation.en: Good. That's telling me
nobody's thinking about anything back home that they shouldn't be thinking about.
translation.ko: 아무도 집과 관련된 생각을 안 한다는 뜻이야 생각해선 안 되는 것들이지

translation.en: I don't coach football for wins and losses.
translation.ko: 내가 코치를 하는 건 승패를 위해서가 아니야

translation.en: I coach football to teach you young guys how to be young men,
translation.ko: 어린 너희한테 청년이 되는 법을 가르치고

translation.en: and when you become your own men,
translation.ko: 너희가 독자적으로 생각할 수 있을 때

translation.en: how to be a stronger man and stand tall on your own two feet.
translation.ko: 더 강한 사람으로 자립하는 법을 가르치기 위해서야

translation.en: I love you guys like you're my own child.
[boy 1] Love you, too.
[boy 2] Love you, too.
[Gawuala] Y'all know my big motto. Who love you?
translation.ko: 내 신조 알지? 누가 너희를 사랑한다고?

translation.en: -[all] You! Coach Gawuala. -Who love me?
-[all] Me. Us. -Who love you?
-[all] Coach Gawuala. -Who love me?
[all] Us.
[Gawuala] Good job, guys.
Y'all can go have fun.
[Gawuala] Every year starts a new Cinderella story.
The Cinderella story never stays the same. There's just a new one every year.
translation.ko: 신데렐라 이야기는 늘 변해요 매년 새로운 이야기가 나오죠

translation.en: It's always beautiful. It's always beautiful.
[Vick] That desire to have that championship,
to be on that stage and say you're a national champion.
translation.ko: 연단에 올라 전국 챔피언이라고 외치는 거

translation.en: It's a chase every year.
[coach] Everybody goes through trials and tribulations,
everybody has to experience things different.
Keeping them off the street, focused at school, disciplined in the home,
translation.ko: 거리에서 멀리 떨어져 학업에 집중하고 가정 교육을 받는 게

translation.en: will ensure that they become positive men as they get older.
translation.ko: 아이들을 긍정적인 사람으로 성장하게 할 거예요

translation.en: And that's our goal.
It's time to go to work, gentlemen. -Let's go. -[boy] Don't be offside.
[Aiden] The game's not all about strength and speed and all of that.
translation.ko: 힘과 속도 같은 게 경기의 전부는 아니에요

translation.en: Probably like 5% of each.
It's all about being wise,
and connecting with all of your teammates.
It's like the coaches.
They see what you can do,
but yourself, you don't know what you can do.
[players] Eleven, twelve, thirteen…
[D-Lo] When Coach Gawuala said that this is your year, I was like,
translation.ko: 가왈라 코치님이 올해는 저의 해라고 했을 때 이렇게 생각했어요

translation.en: "This really is my year. I can shine."
translation.ko: '올해는 내 해구나 난 빛을 발할 거야'

translation.en: "I'm just out here doing my thing. Do what I have to do."
translation.ko: '난 그냥 내 일을 하면 돼' '내가 해야 할 일을'

translation.en: It's gonna be exciting. It's gonna be something never seen before.
translation.ko: 흥미진진할 거예요 처음 보는 일이 되겠죠

translation.en: -[Gawuala] Who the show? -[all] We the show!
-Am I my brother's keeper? -[all] You already know! -Am I my brother's keeper? -[all] You already know!
Number one rule today is to have fun. Is that understood?
[all] Yes, coach!
translation.ko: - 네, 코치님! - 다른 건 관심 없다!

translation.en: All I wanna do is have fun.
translation.ko: - 네, 코치님! - 다른 건 관심 없다! 내가 원하는 건 즐기는 거야!

translation.en: -Is that understood? -Yes, coach!
translation.ko: 내가 원하는 건 즐기는 거야! 네, 코치님!

translation.en: -Rule number one is to do what? -Have fun! -To do what? -Have fun!
I love every last one of you guys.
[cheerleaders] Let's go, Brooklyn, let's go!
translation.ko: - 모두 사랑한다 - 브루클린, 이기자! 브루클린, 이기자!

translation.en: [Gawuala] This one's gonna be epic.
I put my life on the line for this one.
-[whistle blows] -[D-Lo] Go!
Ready… go!
